description: The roles of women inside and outside the Deaf world. How language and cultural barriers perpetuate the roles defined for and by d/Deaf women within Deaf and hearing societies.

name: WGSS3255
prerequisites: There are no prerequisites for this course.
description: Sexuality as a significant axis of citizenship. How sexual citizenship differs in national, historical, and international contexts. How its different constructions influence such issues as welfare, adoption, marriage, and immigration. CA 4-INT.

name: WGSS3255W
description: Sexuality as a significant axis of citizenship. How sexual citizenship differs in national, historical, and international contexts. How its different constructions influence such issues as welfare, adoption, marriage, and immigration. CA 4-INT.

name: WGSS3256
prerequisites: Recommended preparation: WGSS 2250. Not open to students who have passed WGSS 3995 when offered as "Introduction to Queer Studies."
description: Exploration of foundational and current critical theory in feminist, queer, and trans studies. Emphasis on the shared historical development of, transnational and intersectional approaches in, as well as controversies within and between these theoretical perspectives. Among diverse approaches to be considered are major feminist, queer, and trans revisions of critical race, psychoanalytic, Marxist, Foucauldian, indigenous and postcolonial theories. Formerly offered as WGSS 2253.

name: WGSS3257
prerequisites: Open to juniors or higher; sophomores by consent of instructor.  Recommended preparation: any 1000-level WGSS course.
description: Social, historical, cultural, and political constructions of the intersecting categories of gender and disability. Through a wide variety of texts and cultural examples, exploration of how disability is gendered, gender is disabled, and both are interwoven by race, ethnicity, class, nationality, sexuality, and subcultures.

name: WGSS3257W
prerequisites: ENGL 1007 or 1010 or 1011 or 2011; open to juniors or higher; sophomores by consent of instructor . Recommended preparation: any 1000-level WGSS course.
description: Social, historical, cultural, and political constructions of the intersecting categories of gender and disability. Through a wide variety of texts and cultural examples, exploration of how disability is gendered, gender is disabled, and both are interwoven by race, ethnicity, class, nationality, sexuality, and subcultures.

name: WGSS3258
description: Feminist topics in contemporary Latina literature and cultural studies.

name: WGSS3259
description: Topics in Latino literature and cultural studies with an emphasis on masculinity and male authors.

name: WGSS3260
prerequisites: Open only to juniors or higher.
description: The role of ethnicity and race in women's lives. Special attention to communication research on ethnic and racial minority women. CA 4.

name: WGSS3264
prerequisites: Any 1000 or 2000 level WGSS course.
description: Examination of the gendered dimensions of migration and labor in the global economy and its impact on workers in the US and select other countries.

name: WGSS3265W
catalogName: Producing Intersectional, Interdisciplinary and Transnational WGSS Scholarship
prerequisites: WGSS 2250; ENGL 1007 or 1010 or 1011 or 2011; open only to Women's, Gender, and Sexuality Studies majors and minors.
description: Exploration of the theoretical underpinnings of diverse critical scholarship used by WGSS researchers and the significance of praxis for fostering knowledge production in this interdisciplinary, intersectional, and transnational field. Explication of the ethical dilemmas faced by feminist, critical race, queer and trans scholars and other critical scholars, activists, artists, and policy makers. Experiential opportunities in designing and producing WGSS scholarship.

name: WGSS3268
prerequisites: There are no prerequisites for this course.
description: There is no description provided for this course.

name: WGSS3269
prerequisites: Recommended preparation: Any 1000 or 2000 level WGSS course.
description: Examination of social movements as related to intersections of gender, race, sexuality, disability, class, nationality, ethnicity. May include related topics such as capitalism, democracy, globalization, economic justice, the environment, health, sexual freedom.

name: WGSS3270
prerequisites: Open to juniors or higher; sophomores by consent of instructor. Recommended preparation: Any 1000-level or 2000-level WGSS course.
description: Social construction of masculinity and how maleness is gendered. Examination of the multiple forms of masculinity as influenced by differences in social and cultural expressions of gender, race, ethnicity, class, nationality, sexuality, disability and subcultures.

name: WGSS3270W
prerequisites: ENGL 1007 or 1010 or 1011 or 2011; open to juniors or higher; sophomores by consent of instructor. Recommended preparation: Any 1000 or 2000-level WGSS course.
description: Social construction of masculinity and how maleness is gendered. Examination of the multiple forms of masculinity as influenced by differences in social and cultural expressions of gender, race, ethnicity, class, nationality, sexuality, disability and subcultures.

name: WGSS3271
catalogName: Seminar on Rape Education and Awareness I
prerequisites: There are no prerequisites for this course.
description: Explores issues of sexual violence and trains those enrolled to facilitate rape awareness workshops for the campus community. Students are required to attend an intensive two-day training program and participate in weekly seminars.

name: WGSS3272
catalogName: Seminar on Rape Education and Awareness II
prerequisites: WGSS 3271
description: Further explores broader issues of sexual violence and continues to train those enrolled to facilitate rape awareness workshops for the campus community. Students are required to participate in weekly seminars and facilitate rape awareness workshops.

name: WGSS3277
prerequisites: Open only to juniors or higher.
description: Contemporary issues concerning human sexuality; impact upon individuals and family units.

name: WGSS3317
prerequisites: Open only to juniors or higher.
description: Women as offenders, victims and practitioners in the criminal justice system.

name: WGSS3317W
prerequisites: ENGL 1007 or 1010 or 1011 or 2011; open to juniors or higher.
description: Women as offenders, victims and practitioners in the criminal justice system.

name: WGSS3350
prerequisites: There are no prerequisites for this course.
description: Major conceptual and historical problems in the study of gender in anthropology. Women's roles in different historical and contemporary settings, and new understandings of family, kinship, power, and cultural ideologies.

name: WGSS3402
prerequisites: There are no prerequisites for this course.
description: An introduction to Biblical interpretation from a feminist perspective, examining how women are represented in the Hebrew Scriptures and the New Testament.  Issues of authorship, translation, point of view, cultural context and language.

name: WGSS3403
prerequisites: There are no prerequisites for this course.
description: Gender issues in the world's religions. Survey of women's theological standing, ritual activities and participation in a cross-cultural sample of religions, both monotheistic and polytheistic.

name: WGSS3416
catalogName: Gender and Sexuality in Modern Europe
prerequisites: There are no prerequisites for this course.
description: The construction of gender difference and ideas about sexuality in western Europe since 1789. Masculinity and femininity; sexuality, identity and the state; European power and personhood in global context.

name: WGSS3445
prerequisites: Not open to students who have passed or are taking ECON 2445
description: Economic approaches to gender inequality in political representation, economic opportunities, access to education, and health.

name: WGSS3453
prerequisites: Open only to juniors or higher.
description: Social factors shaping women's health, health care, and their roles as health-care providers.

name: WGSS3560
catalogName: Constructions of Race, Gender, and Sexuality in U.S. History
prerequisites: Not open for credit to students who have passed HIST 3095 when taught as Constructions of Race, Gender, and Sexuality in U.S. History.
description: Examination of historical development, interconnections, and complexities of conceptions of race, gender, and sexuality in U.S. from European conquest to the present.

name: WGSS3561
catalogName: History of Women and Gender in the U.S. to 1850
prerequisites: There are no prerequisites for this course.
description: Gender ideologies of indigenous and settler cultures, changing conditions of women's and men's lives as the U.S. became a nation, while emphasizing intersections with ethnicity, race, class, religion, and region.

name: WGSS3562
catalogName: History of Women and Gender in the United States, 1850-Present
prerequisites: There are no prerequisites for this course.
description: History of gender and the lives and cultural representations of women in the U.S., emphasizing intersections with race, sexuality, class, region, and nation.

name: WGSS3609
prerequisites: ENGL 1007 or 1010 or 1011 or 2011; open to juniors or higher.
description: Works written by women from different countries and centuries. CA 4.

name: WGSS3611
prerequisites: ENGL 1007 or 1010 or 1011 or 2011; open to juniors or higher.
description: Modern and contemporary works written by women from different countries. CA 4.

name: WGSS3613
prerequisites: There are no prerequisites for this course.
description: An introduction to themes of sexual diversity in literature, related to lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender issues. CA 4.

name: WGSS3621
prerequisites: There are no prerequisites for this course.
description: Explores the social organization, construction, and politics of sexualities, particular focus on lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer experiences and the intersection of sexualities, gender, race, and class. CA 4.

name: WGSS3621W
description: Explores the social organization, construction, and politics of sexualities, particular focus on lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer experiences and the intersection of sexualities, gender, race, and class. CA 4.

name: WGSS3622
catalogName: History of Gender and Sexuality in Latin America and the Caribbean
prerequisites: There are no prerequisites for this course.
description: Topics may include: empire and colonialism/anti-colonialism; slavery, science, and the state; cultural practices and institutions; feminisms and masculinities; law and public policies; immigration; forms of labor and political mobilization; sex and reproduction; and human rights from historical perspective.

name: WGSS3652
prerequisites: Open only to juniors or higher.
description: An introduction to major philosophical and theoretical debates at the core of black feminist thought, emphasizing the ways in which interlocking systems of oppression uphold and sustain each other.

name: WGSS3672
prerequisites: Open only to juniors or higher.
description: Feminist development theories and practices applied to Third World or Global South countries, and drawing on related social science and humanities traditions.

name: WGSS3718
prerequisites: There are no prerequisites for this course.
description: Feminist approaches to science fiction. Human and non-human embodiments - humans, aliens, and cyborgs - and the social issues their interactions raise: reproduction and colonization; racial, sexual, and gender apartheid; "human" rights and the rule of law. CA 4.

name: WGSS3718W
description: Feminist approaches to science fiction. Human and non-human embodiments - humans, aliens, and cyborgs - and the social issues their interactions raise: reproduction and colonization; racial, sexual, and gender apartheid; "human" rights and the rule of law. CA 4.

name: WGSS3891
prerequisites: One WGSS course; WGSS 3894 must be taken concurrently.
description: A field placement 9-18 hours per week in an organization related to the student's major field of study. Such work is overseen by the field work supervisor and the Women's, Gender, and Sexuality Studies Internship Coordinator.

name: WGSS3894
prerequisites: There are no prerequisites for this course.
description: A weekly seminar on women and work in which students integrate their field experience with readings, class discussion and guest lecturers.

name: WGSS3993
prerequisites: There are no prerequisites for this course.
description: May be repeated for credit. Consent of program director required, normally before the student's departure. May count toward the major with consent of the director.

name: WGSS3995
prerequisites: Prerequisites and recommended preparation vary.
description: With a change in content, may be repeated for credit.

name: WGSS3998
prerequisites: Prerequisites and recommended preparation vary.
description: With a change of topic, may be repeated for credit.

name: WGSS3999
prerequisites: There are no prerequisites for this course.
description: May be repeated for credit with a change in subject matter.

name: WGSS4100
prerequisites: There are no prerequisites for this course.
description: Interdisciplinary examination of the history of social justice organizing in the U.S.; theories, strategies, and practice of community organizing movements such as those for immigration, environmental, reproductive, and racial justice. Includes practice in community organizing and political advocacy.

name: WGSS4994W
prerequisites: ENGL 1007 or 1010 or 1011 or 2011; open to Women's, Gender, and Sexuality Studies majors only. Recommended preparation: WGSS 3265 and PHIL 3218.
description: Capstone course integrating and analyzing Women's, Gender, and Sexuality Studies theory and substance through research on a common topic and discussion of advanced texts.
